result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian J Skjerly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Per C-31.  Joint and several.
To be paid from prison wages only.

AMENDED 9/10/15:  RESTITUTION ORDER FILED SETTING RESTITUTION AT ZERO.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

9/11/14 Letter to Judge Babler from Attorney Hinde regarding Defendant's Motion to return seized property.

Defendant Ian J Skjerly in court with attorney John G. Hinde and attorney Ryan Raymond. Defendant Ian J Skjerly in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Plea agreement; Defendant pleads guilty to the amended charge.  Amended information filed amending the charge to 940.05(1)(b).   2nd degree intentional homicide. Court allows the filing of the amended information. The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found.  Bond is Revoked.

PSI ordered.
